repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body: lua_tolstring only handle number or string, may crash in some case

comment_data.body: `luaL_` isn't part of Nvim's namespace, so we shouldn't be defining functions with that prefix.
What name is suitable? I am not sure Neovim will port some other luaL_ functions from Lua5.2.
Based on the other code in this file, `nlua_` seems to be our prefix.

comment_regular_data.body:
The tests will be failed because I change the `nlua_error` function. I'm not sure that the output of `nlua_tolstring` looks good, need some comments here.

BTW, should I write tests? If yes,  which file should I write them in?

It might be better to do the conversion from `error object` to `string` in `errfunc` passed to `lua_pcall` in [`nlua_pcall`](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/82c7a82c3585100e73e154c49e3e002b7dc35437/src/nvim/lua/executor.c#L123) and pass it to `debug.traceback`. Then backtrace will be displayed even if the `error object` is not a `string`. Also, I don't think a conversion as complex as this PR is necessary. Wouldn't the same conversion as the current [`nlua_error`](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/82c7a82c3585100e73e154c49e3e002b7dc35437/src/nvim/lua/executor.c#L91) be fine?

> BTW, should I write tests? If yes, which file should I write them in?

How about putting the test in [test/functional/lua/loop_spec.lua](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/master/test/functional/lua/loop_spec.lua)?

> It might be better to do the conversion from `error object` to `string` in `errfunc` passed to `lua_pcall` in [`nlua_pcall`](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/82c7a82c3585100e73e154c49e3e002b7dc35437/src/nvim/lua/executor.c#L123) and pass it to `debug.traceback`. Then backtrace will be displayed even if the `error object` is not a `string`. 

It's unnecessary for the `errfunc`, because `debug.traceback` can't handle table or metastable. And the message maybe contain a trackback string, we shouldn't add an extra trackback. The `nlua_tolstring` is like its name, just convert the data to a string.

```lua
print(xpcall(function ()
    error('the raw error')
end, function (msg)
    error('wtf!')
end))
```
will output `false, error in error handling`. The output of error in `nlua_tolstring` is more like `xpcall`.

> Also, I don't think a conversion as complex as this PR is necessary. Wouldn't the same conversion as the current [nlua_error](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/82c7a82c3585100e73e154c49e3e002b7dc35437/src/nvim/lua/executor.c#L91) be fine?

nlua_error will crash for `bad_custom_error2` from the snippet I post. `nlua_tolstring` can convert data to string safely. Why not?

As a data point, when trying to update Debian's package to v0.9.2, I reliably get a crash when running the "reports non-existent man pages for absolute paths" plugin/man_spec.lua test.

```
           PID: 1491300 (nvim)
           UID: 1000 (jamessan)
           GID: 1000 (jamessan)
        Signal: 11 (SEGV)
     Timestamp: Sat 2023-09-16 21:04:20 EDT (25min ago)
  Command Line: /build/neovim-ejD4o0/neovim-0.9.2/build/bin/nvim -ll /build/neovim-ejD4o0/neovim-0.9.2/test/busted_runner.lua -v -o test.busted.outputHandlers.nvim --lazy --helper=/build/neovim-ejD4o0/neovim-0.9.2/test/functional/preload.lua $'--lpath=/build/neovim-ejD4o0/neovim-0.9.2/build/?.lua' $'--lpath=/build/neovim-ejD4o0/neovim-0.9.2/runtime/lua/?.lua' $'--lpath=?.lua' test/functional
    Executable: /run/schroot/mount/unstable-amd64-sbuild-dc78ebcc-b7a5-40bd-b99c-2a997bbb8017/build/neovim-ejD4o0/neovim-0.9.2/build/bin/nvim
 Control Group: /user.slice/user-1000.slice/session-2.scope
          Unit: session-2.scope
         Slice: user-1000.slice
       Session: 2
     Owner UID: 1000 (jamessan)
       Boot ID: 9faac5d4fc3646c98bf2a96c0c77e622
    Machine ID: 8fed24a741c644bc94ce5863de12213c
      Hostname: odin
       Storage: /var/lib/systemd/coredump/core.nvim.1000.9faac5d4fc3646c98bf2a96c0c77e622.1491300.1694912660000000.zst (present)
  Size on Disk: 52.0M
       Message: Process 1491300 (nvim) of user 1000 dumped core.

(gdb) bt
#0  __strlen_avx2 () at ../sysdeps/x86_64/multiarch/strlen-avx2.S:76
#1  0x00007fc2f8415295 in __GI__IO_fputs (str=0x0, fp=0x7fc2f85756a0 <_IO_2_1_stderr_>) at ./libio/iofputs.c:33
#2  0x0000558471732b61 in nlua_error (lstate=0x7fc2f831d380, msg=0x55847198e538 "E5113: Error while calling lua chunk: %.*s") at ./src/nvim/lua/executor.c:138
#3  0x0000558471737561 in nlua_exec_file (path=0x7ffd66d18e84 "/build/neovim-ejD4o0/neovim-0.9.2/test/busted_runner.lua") at ./src/nvim/lua/executor.c:1803
#4  0x0000558471734b4e in nlua_run_script (argv=0x7ffd66d171a8, argc=12, lua_arg0=3) at ./src/nvim/lua/executor.c:831
#5  0x000055847158e74a in main (argc=12, argv=0x7ffd66d171a8) at ./src/nvim/main.c:256
```

With this PR, I don't.
Looks alright. how about a test or two of something which crashes on master?

title: fix(executor): port luaL_tolstring from Lua 5.2 (#18359)
